name: extracted .223 OCG Blackout
description: 131gr projectile of a .223 OCG Blackout round removed from its casing. Cannot be put back. Perhaps may yet be useful.

name: unused .22 ETC casing
description: An unfired, like-new .22 ETC round casing, with the plasma cartridge still intact.

name: extracted .22 ETC TB
description: 100gr projectile of a .22 ETC TB round removed from its casing. Cannot be put back, perhaps may yet be useful.

name: extracted .22 ETC micro-flechette
description: 9gr micro-flechette of a .22 ETC round removed from its plastic capsule. Cannot be put back and is too tiny for nail guns. Perhaps may yet be useful.

name: extracted 5.56mm ETC SAP
description: 154gr projectile of a 5.56 ETC SAP or 5.56 OCG Blackout round removed from its casing. Cannot be put back. Perhaps may yet be useful.

name: extracted 9mm ETC HAPM
description: 40gr projectile of a 9mm ETC HAPM round removed from its casing. Cannot be put back or further disassembled. Perhaps may yet be useful.

name: extracted 9mm ETC SAP
description: 262gr projectile of a 9mm ETC SAP round removed from its casing. Cannot be put back. Perhaps may yet be useful.

name: small pistol plasma cartridge
description: Plasma cartridge from a small electrothermal-chemical pistol round.

name: small rifle plasma cartridge
description: Plasma cartridge from a small electrothermal-chemical rifle round.

name: large rifle plasma cartridge
description: Plasma cartridge from a large electrothermal-chemical rifle round.

name: rifle nanoreactor
description: A liquid core reactor with milliseconds of operational lifetime that fits inside a large rifle round case, it has enough power for one shot in an electrothermal-chemical weapon.

name: handmade rifle nanoreactor
description: A liquid core reactor with milliseconds of operational lifetime that fits inside a large rifle round case for UPS-free electrothermal operation. The product of either a genius or insane survivor atomic scientist, but not both; radiation poisoning will likely doom its maker

name: dosed plutonium slurry
description: A tiny dose of highly radioactive slurry from a nanoreactor, which could be used to craft a self-charged 7.62mm electrothermal-chemical round. Maybe you should give up and get far away from this instead.
